result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Terry L. Kolstad was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay $2200 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Attend Victim Impact Panel.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is deceased.
Dodge Correctional Institution

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad appeared by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Petition by DOC. State has no objection. Court makes statement, grants petition, orders that remaining portion of confinement is converted to ES, requests that DOC prepare proposed Order.
Confirmed 7/11 video conference with Dodge
of extraordinary health condition
Geriatric/Extraordinary health condition
to Modify Birfucated Sentence - Geriatric/Extraordinary health condition
Motion hearing on July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
of Sentencing Hearing held 12/17/15

from Marsha Bailey re: Defendant's health status. Per Court, I am sorry to learn of Terry's diagnosis; once sentenced, these decisions are entirely up to the Dept. of Corrections. See Wis. Stats. 303.068 "Leave for qualified inmates." I would work through the prison. Good luck.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (joint except length of ES). Bond no longer in effect.
Letter to Attys enclosing PSI

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with 5 prior convictions. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Monthly billing for court appointed attorney fee. Court approves bill.
Court appointed atty bill for the month of August from Atty Erickson. Court approves bill.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Erickson indicates defendant will probably be waiving the preliminary hearing but needs time to discuss matter with him. Defendant waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Contract for repayment of court-appointed attorney fees
Court appoints Atty Grant Erickson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 9/15/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry L. Kolstad in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not qualify for PD representation, filled out form for court appointed atty and handed it in to jail staff. Court hasn't seen form yet. Court will review petition and put matter back on the calendar for next week. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 7/25/15.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Terry L. Kolstad appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
